events.name: China Urges G20 to Address Global Debt Issues
events.wd_label: China Urges G20 to Address Global Debt Issues
events.wd_description: China called on G20 nations to conduct a fair and comprehensive analysis of global debt issues, emphasizing the need for joint actions by international financial institutions and commercial creditors.
events.description: China called on G20 nations to conduct a fair and comprehensive analysis of global debt issues, emphasizing the need for joint actions by international financial institutions and commercial creditors.

events.name: China's Call for Action
events.wd_description: China urged G20 nations to tackle global debt issues comprehensively and effectively, stressing the importance of joint actions by international financial institutions and commercial creditors.
events.description: China urged G20 nations to tackle global debt issues comprehensively and effectively, stressing the importance of joint actions by international financial institutions and commercial creditors.

events.name: G20 Finance Ministers Meeting
events.wd_description: China's Finance Minister Liu Kun participated in a video meeting with G20 finance ministers and central bank chiefs in Bengaluru, India, calling for a fair analysis of global debt issues.
events.description: China's Finance Minister Liu Kun participated in a video meeting with G20 finance ministers and central bank chiefs in Bengaluru, India, calling for a fair analysis of global debt issues.

events.name: Upcoming IMF Debt Roundtable
events.wd_description: Officials from the IMF, World Bank, and G7 nations will meet for the first face-to-face discussions at the new IMF Global Sovereign Debt Roundtable, with Zambia and Ghana awaiting China's support on debt restructuring.
events.description: Officials from the IMF, World Bank, and G7 nations will meet for the first face-to-face discussions at the new IMF Global Sovereign Debt Roundtable, with Zambia and Ghana awaiting China's support on debt restructuring.

events.name: AUKUS Pact Unveils Plan for Nuclear-Powered Submarine Fleet
events.wd_label: AUKUS Pact Unveils Plan for Nuclear-Powered Submarine Fleet
events.wd_description: The UK, US, and Australia revealed details of their plan under the AUKUS pact to create a new fleet of nuclear-powered submarines, aimed at countering China's influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
events.description: The UK, US, and Australia revealed details of their plan under the AUKUS pact to create a new fleet of nuclear-powered submarines, aimed at countering China's influence in the Indo-Pacific region.

events.name: AUKUS Pact Announcement
events.wd_description: The United Kingdom, United States, and Australia announced a plan to develop a new fleet of nuclear-powered submarines as part of the AUKUS pact, with the goal of countering China's influence in the Indo-Pacific.
events.description: The United Kingdom, United States, and Australia announced a plan to develop a new fleet of nuclear-powered submarines as part of the AUKUS pact, with the goal of countering China's influence in the Indo-Pacific.

events.name: Australia's Nuclear-Powered Submarines
events.wd_description: The United States will provide Australia with its first-ever nuclear-powered submarines, marking a significant upgrade to the Australian military.
events.description: The United States will provide Australia with its first-ever nuclear-powered submarines, marking a significant upgrade to the Australian military.

events.name: US and UK Support and Training
events.wd_label: US and UK Support and Training
events.wd_description: Australian navy sailors will be sent to US and UK submarine bases for training on how to operate the nuclear-powered submarines, with the technology being shared under the AUKUS pact.
events.description: Australian navy sailors will be sent to US and UK submarine bases for training on how to operate the nuclear-powered submarines, with the technology being shared under the AUKUS pact.

events.name: EU and UK Agree to New Trade Rules in Northern Ireland
events.wd_label: EU and UK Agree to New Trade Rules in Northern Ireland
events.wd_description: The European Union and the United Kingdom agreed to the "Windsor Framework," a new trade deal aimed at addressing post-Brexit challenges in Northern Ireland, ensuring smooth trade and protecting Northern Ireland's place in the UK.
events.description: The European Union and the United Kingdom agreed to the "Windsor Framework," a new trade deal aimed at addressing post-Brexit challenges in Northern Ireland, ensuring smooth trade and protecting Northern Ireland's place in the UK.

events.name: Announcement of Windsor Framework
events.wd_description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced the "Windsor Framework," a new trade deal to address the post-Brexit trade issues in Northern Ireland.
events.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced the "Windsor Framework," a new trade deal to address the post-Brexit trade issues in Northern Ireland.

events.name: UK-EU Relations Post-Brexit
events.wd_description: Ursula von der Leyen acknowledged the tense relationship between the UK and EU since Brexit, emphasizing the need for new solutions to strengthen their partnership.
events.description: Ursula von der Leyen acknowledged the tense relationship between the UK and EU since Brexit, emphasizing the need for new solutions to strengthen their partnership.

events.name: Key Areas of Improvement
events.wd_description: The Windsor Framework outlines improvements in three key areas of the Northern Ireland Protocol to ensure smooth trade and protect Northern Ireland's sovereignty within the UK.
events.description: The Windsor Framework outlines improvements in three key areas of the Northern Ireland Protocol to ensure smooth trade and protect Northern Ireland's sovereignty within the UK.

events.name: Expansion of Chinese companies in the U.S. EV supply chain
events.wd_label: Expansion of Chinese companies in the U.S. EV supply chain
events.wd_description: Chinese manufacturers and tech companies are increasingly participating in the U.S. EV supply chain to meet growing demand. This expansion has sparked a mix of support and concern among U.S. stakeholders.
events.description: Chinese manufacturers and tech companies are increasingly participating in the U.S. EV supply chain to meet growing demand. This expansion has sparked a mix of support and concern among U.S. stakeholders.

events.name: Ford-CATL battery plant
events.wd_description: Ford announced a $3.5 billion plant in Michigan to build batteries using technology from China's CATL. The plant aims to take advantage of EV tax credits by being 100% owned by Ford.
events.description: Ford announced a $3.5 billion plant in Michigan to build batteries using technology from China's CATL. The plant aims to take advantage of EV tax credits by being 100% owned by Ford.

events.name: Foxconn-Lordstown Motors joint venture
events.wd_description: Foxconn, known for manufacturing iPhones in China, has formed a joint venture with Lordstown Motors to build electric pickups in Ohio.
events.description: Foxconn, known for manufacturing iPhones in China, has formed a joint venture with Lordstown Motors to build electric pickups in Ohio.

events.name: BYD's potential battery plant
events.wd_description: Chinese EV maker BYD is considering building a battery plant in the U.S., indicating further expansion of Chinese companies in the U.S. EV market.
events.description: Chinese EV maker BYD is considering building a battery plant in the U.S., indicating further expansion of Chinese companies in the U.S. EV market.

events.name: Political responses
events.wd_description: The expansion of Chinese companies in the U.S. EV market has elicited mixed political responses, with some U.S. officials expressing concerns over Chinese influence while others support the investments.
events.description: The expansion of Chinese companies in the U.S. EV market has elicited mixed political responses, with some U.S. officials expressing concerns over Chinese influence while others support the investments.

events.name: t: Governor responses
events.wd_description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin opposed Ford's venture with CATL, calling it a "Trojan horse" for the Communist Party of China, while Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer supported the investment as beneficial for local communities.
events.description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin opposed Ford's venture with CATL, calling it a "Trojan horse" for the Communist Party of China, while Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer supported the investment as beneficial for local communities.

events.name: t: Congressional scrutiny
events.wd_description: Congressional scrutiny of Chinese involvement in U.S. EV facilities is expected to increase, driven by both sincere concerns and political motivations.
events.description: Congressional scrutiny of Chinese involvement in U.S. EV facilities is expected to increase, driven by both sincere concerns and political motivations.

events.name: EV tax credit requirements
events.wd_description: For EVs to qualify for tax credits under the Inflation Reduction Act, they need to be assembled with U.S.-made components, a challenging standard for many vehicles.
events.description: For EVs to qualify for tax credits under the Inflation Reduction Act, they need to be assembled with U.S.-made components, a challenging standard for many vehicles.
